Projects

Projects (9)
Sedimentary ancient DNA - a new proxy to investigate the impact of environmental change on past and present biodiversity in Nordic Seas (NEEDED)
Project
The aim of the project is to provide a unique insight into the impact of climate change on Nordic Seas biodiversity focusing on its most inconspicuous but ecologically essential microbial and meiofaunal components. We will use sedaDNA as a new promising palaeoceanographic proxy complementary to the traditionally used microfossils. The innovative character of the project consists in integrating multitaxon analysis of sedaDNA with the existing palaeoceanographic proxies in order to reconstruct changes in eukaryotic biodiversity during the postglacial period.
View
  • 1 Update
Distinguishing tsunami and storm deposits affected by postdepositional processes – a multi-proxy approach (TSUNASTORM)
Project
The three main questions are: - What are the postdepositional changes of marine flooding event deposits on an annual, decadal, and centennial-scale? - Is it possible to distinguish storm and tsunami deposits using a modern multiproxy approach, for deposits left in the same geological context? - Does the integration of the novel molecular (sedimentary DNA) approach provide a way to distinguish storm and tsunami deposits? The ultimate goal is to provide a multiproxy complementary study of tsunami and storm deposits with consideration of postdepositional changes and the development of a new DNA-based approach in order to develop an objective way of discrimination of tsunami and storm deposits in geological records.
View
IndiRed
Project
We want to develop novel indicators of anthropogenic impact on estuarine and coastal ecosystems based on ecological interaction networks, predicted using high throughput sequencing of environmental DNA (eDNA metabarcoding). By combining data from microorganisms, meio- and macrobenthos or plankton, we will also improve the understanding of these marine ecosystems, and how they are affected by contamination, climate change and other impacts. For more information, check https://www.azti.es/en/proyectos/indred/
View
